result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Avery Jensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the jail sentence may be served with huber.

miscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to be employed or seeking employment or be in school.
2.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Avery Jensen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year, New Discharge Date September 16, 2017

1:02 pm
Defendant Michael Avery Jensen in court. Agent Todd Mueller in court.
Court questions Defendant regarding balance due.
Defendant makes statement about on and off employment.
Court finds the Defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for 1 year.  Court informs the Defendant that, if not paid, the Court will fashion conditions to include jail time up to 60 days.
Court adjourned at 1:07 pm
Probation review hearing on August 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
10:14 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will enter a plea.  DA recites agreement, upon plea to the charge, will request court costs, defense is free to argue.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  9 months county jail stayed and places the defendant on 18 months of probation.  Huber if revoked.

CONDITIONS:
Court costs.
Defendant is to be employed or seeking employment or in school
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court adjourned at 10:23 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

10:48 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - an offer has been received and not sure why the defendant is not present.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on March 16, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:49 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

2:38 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Atty Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Barb Privat - an agreement has been received and accepted and requests 30 days.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on February 17, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:39 p.m.
Status hearing on January 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

1:37 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.

Attorney Privat indicates the defendant is waiving his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Privat.  Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 1:39 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on December 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

1:49 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Atty Barb Privat present on behalf of the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat, requests a preliminary hearing be scheduled.  Court will set for preliminary hearing in 30 days.

Court adjourned at 1:50 p.m.
Status hearing on November 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

3:10 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present, in custody and via video from Green Lake County Jail, with Attorney Barb Privat.

Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.

Court orders bond set at $1,000.00 Signature Bond.

Attorney Privat waives time limits as to the Preliminary Hearing.  

Court directs Status Hearing to be scheduled with Attorney Privat.

Court adjourned at 3:12 p.m.
